text: Daniël D'Hondt (born 21 September 1961) is a Belgian retired professional goalkeeper who ended his career in 2001.D'Hondt: "Liever keeper in Westerlo dan in Meldert" ==Playing career== D'Hondt spent the most of his career in Lokeren.Dannie D'Hondt sleept Lokeren voor rechtbank In summer 2000, he joined NAC Breda.Dannie D'Hondt tekent vandaag contract bij NACDannie D'Hondt vandaag naar NAC Later he moved abroad and joined Dinamo Tbilisi as well, becoming only third player from outside the former Soviet Union to play in the Georgian Premier League after Carlos Alberto Pinha da Rocha and Uchechukwu Uwakwe.Dinamo sign BrazilianDannie D'Hondt keert terug naar België ==Coaching career== After D'Hondt became coach and managed VW Hamme in 2009.Dannie D'hondt profileVOETBAL 2DE KLASSE VW HAMME - URS DU CENTRE Dannie D'Hondt wil scoren met verjongd Vigor-WuitensVOETBAL 3de klasse Eindronde Dannie D'Hondt prijst grote inzet bij Vigor-Wuitens Hamme ==References== == External links == * Daniël D'Hondt Interview * * * * Category:Belgian footballers Category:Belgian expatriate footballers Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:FC Dinamo Tbilisi players Category:K.S.C. title: Daniël D'Hondt
